messages.title: Our Pledge to East Chesterton Residents
messages.content: UKIP supports an Australian-style points based system to slash the volume of immigration and end the undercutting of the wages of British working people. UKIP will increase spending on the NHS by £3bn, funded by our EU contributions and will clamp down on so-called “health tourism” so that our brilliant doctors and nurses are once more able to concentrate on delivering first class care to the British people. UKIP will reduce foreign aid spending from £11bn to £2bn and use the savings to cut taxes for hard-pressed British families. A UKIP government will prioritise people with local connections in the queue for social housing and implement a ban on non-British nationals exercising the right to buy social housing apart from those foreign nationals who have served in the HM Armed Forces. UKIP will scrap the unjust income tax that hits so many families in Cambridge.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Supports an Australian-style points based system to reduce immigration.
Pledges to increase spending on the NHS by £3bn, funded by EU contributions and clamp down on health tourism.
Plans to reduce foreign aid spending from £11bn to £2bn.
Will prioritise people with local connections for social housing and ban non-British nationals from the right to buy, except those who have served in the HM Armed Forces.
Intends to scrap the unjust income tax affecting many families.

issues.economy: Will use savings from reduced foreign aid to cut taxes for British families.
issues.health: Increase NHS spending by £3bn and address health tourism.
issues.immigration: Supports implementing an Australian-style points based immigration system.
issues.socialWelfare: Prioritize local connections in social housing and safeguard rights for veterans.

images.caption: Your UKIP Team for East Chesterton leaflet, featuring policies and pledges from candidates Patrick O'Flynn and Peter Burkinshaw.
